Synonymns: आरग्वध - That which removes diseases.
राजवृक्ष - A beautiful tree like a king.
चतुरङ्गुल - Inside the fruit, the marrow is demarcated at every four finger distance.
शम्पाकः- As a drug provides well being.
कृतमाल- Flowers appear like a garland.
दीर्घफल: - The fruits are long and stick like.
आरेवत – expels the mala from the body.
Habitat: Grows all over India and as it is a beautiful plant, it is cultivated in gardens.
Morphology: Leaves - Leaves 8-16 inch long, leaflets 8 pairs, ovate, acuminate.
Flowers -  beautiful, Golden yellow in colour.
Fruits - stick like, long with marrow inside.
Karma: Bruhana Karma, jwarahara, kustaghna, best sramsaka.
Amayika_Prayoga: Amavata - leaves of aragwadha are fried with mustard oil and chewed after evening meal.
Jwara - phalamajja +drasha rasa or cow milk
Shlok: ज्वरे तु सततं पथ्यम् कोस्थशुद्धिकरं परं । ( भा नि )

Synonymns: अभया - It rejuvenates the body and wards off for fears.
अमृता - It has rejuvenation quality and protects from old-age disorder.
जीवंती - It brings back normalcy and promotes strength.
पथ्या - It is very much conducive to the channels and never harm mind and body.
वयस्या - It promotes longevity.
श्रेयसी - It is best and auspicious drug.
पंचभद्रिका - It has five rasa.
Classification: Charaka - Vayasthapana varga, Jwarahara varga, virecanopaga varga, kusthaghna varga, prajasthapana varga, arsoghna varga, hikkanigrahana varga
Types: Vijaya, Cetaki, Putana, Rohini, Amrita, Abhaya, Jivanti
Habitat: Found all over India especially in firsts of North India, central province and South India
Habit: Moderte to large size deciduous tree.
Morphology: Leaves - alternate or subopposite, pubescent usually with two glands near the top.
Rasapanchaka: Rasa - Kasaya, Madhura, Amla, Katu, Tikta
Karma: Rasayana, Medhya Anulomana, Swasahara, Lekhana, Dipana, Pachana.
Therapeutic_indication: Vibandha, swasa, kasa, prameha, arsha, sotha.

Synonymns: स्थूलदला - Kumari has very big and thick leaves
घृतकुमारी - leaves of Kumari have juice which resembles ghee.
कन्या - Kumari possesses rejuvenative qualities and it is also very useful in disorders of teenage girls.
गृहकन्य - it is home medicine for women.
Habitat: Cultivated throughout India as a comercial plant.
Morphology: Leaves - large succulent, subulate. Leaves flat or slightly concave on the upper surface, sessile and spiny toothed at the margin.
Flowers -  Pendulous, yellow or orange coloured
Amayika_Prayoga: Pleehavriddhi - Kumari swaras + haridra churna + jiraka
Vrana - kalka prepared from Kumari rasa + jiraka applied on the site

Synonymns: पृथकपर्णी - Leaves of prisniparni appear very special and very district from other plants.
सिंहपृच्छि - Inflorescence of prisiniparni resembles the tail of a lion.
चित्रपर्णी - Prisiniparni leaves are mottled.
धावनी - prisiniparni expels the toxins from the bud.
Classification: Charak - Sandhaniya varga, Sothahara varga, Angamardaprasamana varga.
Sushruta - Vidarigandhadi varga, Haridradi varga, Laghupanchmula.
Habitat: Grows throughout India. It is commonly seen in dry grass lands, waste places and open forests.
Habit: An erect, little branched, perennial herb, grows 1 to 2 m in height.
Morphology: Leaves - Leaves imparipinnate, 20 to30 cm long including petiole, leaflets on upper part 5-7, linear oblong.
Flowers -  Flower, purple in colour, in close fascicles along the rachis, downy with hooked hair, calyx longer
Fruits - pod, glabrous, pale lead coloured.
Amayika_Prayoga: Vatarakta - Prushnaparni swarasa processed with aja kshir + sugar and honey.
